innodb	myisam---------------------------------------------------

faster slower use
('innodb', 'slightly faster', 'myisam', '30776508', 'innodb seems slightly faster than myisam but this is really marginal\n')
('innodb', 'slower', 'myisam', '21863823', 'at the beginning the insert performance of innodb is almost 50 times slower than myisam and tokudb is 40 times slower than myisam\n')
('myisam', 'faster', 'innodb', '32692860', 'speed does matter here myisam is still slightly faster than innodb especially for reads\n')
('myisam', 'slightly faster', 'innodb', '4233878', 'myisam is slightly faster than innodb and implements the fulltext index which is quite useful for integrating search capabilities\n')
('myisam', 'faster', 'innodb', '5676173', 'myisam is faster than innodb for reads myth\n')
('innodb', 'slower', 'myisam', '6348127', 'generally speaking innodb is slower than myisam as innodb is atomic while myisam is not\n')
('myisam', 'faster', 'innodb', '1647078', 'i am not sure if this is no longer true myisam is faster than innodb for reads\n')
('myisam', 'faster', 'innodb', '4459983', 'some people have said that for reads myisam is faster but recent improvements in innodb have either alleviated or eradicated this difference\n')
